title: What is the best way for an adult to learn how to play piano? - Quora
tags: Learning Piano as an Older Adult
Learning to Play the Piano as an Adult

response.answer_text: That’s THREE different skills or activities, not one. They get unified at various points of activity, but let’s start with playing piano. Get your hands on it, explore lots of playing, how the fingers can stretch, different tones it can make, and do practices of running up and down the piano with one hand playing it, to get the fingers used to playing in a key and hitting THOSE notes only, and learn some keys, such as C major, E minor, A sharp major, etc., and just build your physical skill, your interaction with the instrument daily.To read music, I found it amazingly helpful to listen to some music while watching the sheet music of it at the same time. You’ll need to learn not only the notes, but how they show loudness, length of note, rests, slurs, sharp attacks, etc., by using notation like a language. Buy a music notation book, and also buy some enjoyable classical music and then buy the sheet music for it too. A concerto or symphony would be helpful, so you can follow along either with one instrument, or lots of instruments, so see how it moves, see the notation and see how instruments are combined. There are also YouTube videos of computer readouts of sheet music, showing the music being played on the sheet at the same time you hear it. Look for those!To write music is a natural extension of developing your ability from the #2 answer above, and then grabbing some blank sheet music paper and a pen. If you want to write your own music, one trick I use is to simply write down notes on the C-key in the upper clef of sheet music, and then I can capture anything, a whistled riff, a longer musical idea, something I hear on the radio, and write down the notes, and then I can reset the key or correct the notation later. But at least I’ve captured the essence of it immediately in enough detail to make me hear it again as soon as I see it on the sheet. Practice this. Use simple music. Just practice it, but also build your skills by learning notation with the #2 answer above.Send me a copy of your first CD.
